importantArticles.headline: General Motors (NYSE:GM) recently announced a partnership with GM Energy and EnergyHub to integrate electric vehicles and energy storage solutions into utility programs across the U.S., providing financial incentives to eligible EV owners. Despite these efforts towards innovation and energy management, General Motors saw a 4% decline in its share price over the last month. This decline occurred amidst broader market volatility driven by uncertainty surrounding potential tariffs announced by...
importantArticles.title: General Motors (NYSE:GM) Partners With EnergyHub For U.S. Grid Incentives Amid 10% Share Dip

importantArticles.headline: President Trump made good on his tariff promise for foreign made autos, slapping 25% tariffs across the board on foreign-made automobiles.
importantArticles.title: Trump makes good on auto tariff threat with 25% levy on foreign-made cars

importantArticles.headline: DETROIT (Reuters) -General Motors plans to increase production of light-duty trucks at its Fort Wayne, Indiana, assembly plant, it said in a webcast sent to plant employees on Thursday and viewed by Reuters, after President Donald Trump announced 25% tariffs on auto imports.  GM CEO Mary Barra had hinted at the possibility of increasing the output of trucks in the United States during GM's January earnings call in response to tariffs.
importantArticles.title: Exclusive-GM to increase truck production in Indiana following Trump's tariffs

importantArticles.headline: Investing.com -- The U.S. auto sector is heading into a potentially severe disruption, with Bernstein warning that upcoming tariffs could move the industry from “earnings pressure to supply chain fragility.”
importantArticles.title: Is the U.S. auto sector ready for a policy-induced storm? Bernstein weighs in

importantArticles.headline: GM sells 442,000 vehicles in China in Q1, almost flat year over year but down sequentially. With rising local competition, GM faces a tough battle ahead.
importantArticles.title: How's General Motors Faring in China Amid Fierce Competition?

importantArticles.headline: Trump's tariffs have thrown the auto industry into turmoil, with Canada hitting back. Consumers and automakers now brace up for rising costs and disruptions.
importantArticles.title: Canada's Retaliatory Tariffs Fuel Trump's Trade War, Roil Auto Sector
